Sentencas: In this paper, a parametric study of the performance of a SOFC system for several types of supplied fuels is carried out.
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system

Sentencas: A SOFC system which is assisted by some energy resources, namely biomass, solar energy and natural gas, i.e. methane, is designed in order to realize this study.
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system

Sentencas: This system consists of four main components which are Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC), Proton Exchange Membrane Electrolyser (PEME), Photovoltaic system (PV), and Anaerobic Digester for biogas production (AD).
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system

Sentencas: The system is designed by considering three fundamental operation modes which are day-time (Ml), night-time (M2), and winter-time (M3), in accordance with the duration of solar irradiation period.
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system

Sentencas: In order to evaluate the performance of the system, comprehensive energy and exergy analyses are performed, as major system parameters are changed for the operation modes considered.
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system

Sentencas: In this study, maximum total energy and exergy efficiency values of 0.60 and 0.49, respectively, are achieved when the overall energy and exergy performance of the system is evaluated, at 5500 A/m(2) current density for M3 operation mode among the three operation modes considered.
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system

Sentencas: Finally, the maximum net electrical energy and exergy efficiencies are achieved for 633 degrees C SOFC fuel inlet temperature and 8000 A/m(2) current density, in this study.
Titulo: A parametric study on thermodynamic performance of a SOFC oriented hybrid energy system
